noun.description: The buoyant, light brown substance obtained from the outer layer of the bark of the cork oak.

verb.description: Close or seal (a bottle) with a cork.
Illicitly hollow out (a baseball bat) and fill it with cork to make it lighter.

proper noun.description: A county in the Republic of Ireland, in the province of Munster, on the Celtic Sea.

origin: Middle English: from Dutch and Low German kork, from Spanish alcorque cork-soled sandal, from Arabic al- the and (probably) Spanish Arabic qurq, qorq, based on Latin quercus oak, cork oak.
